newsitem.title: ROMANIA: SOCCER-SICHITIU NAMED RAPID HEAD FOR SECOND TIME.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SICHITIU NAMED RAPID HEAD FOR SECOND TIME.

text.p: Struggling Romanian club Rapid Bucharest has appointed Grigore Sichitiu as general manager for the second time, the club's chief owner said on Tuesday.
"Sichitiu is the right person for Rapid, which is going through a difficult situation," George Copos, Rapid's main shareholder, told reporters.
Sichitiu, 45, replaced Jean Padureanu, who quit earlier this month as Rapid languished in 12th place in the first division.
He was appointed Rapid's general manager for the first time in January 1995, but was fired within six months after the club was upset in the cup final by Petrolul Ploiesti.
Rapid Bucharest still manage to attract the league's largest number of fans despite their poor showing this season.
